knimeNode.name: RDKit Add Conformers
knimeNode.shortDescription: Creates a new table with multiple conformers per input molecule.

fullDescription.intro: Creates a new table with multiple conformers per input molecule. Each conformer is a copy of the molecule with different coordinates assigned. Each conformer row is mapped back to the input table molecule with an identifier - usually the row id - taken from an input table column.

tab.name: Input
tab.option: The input column with RDKit Molecules.
The input column with reference data to be assigned to conformer rows.

tab.name: Conformer Calculation
tab.option: Number of conformers to be generated.

option.name: Maximum number of tries to generate conformers

tab.option: Maximum number of tries that the RDKit will use to generate conformers.
A random seed to initialize random number generator.

option.name: RMS threshold for keeping a conformer

tab.option: The RMS threshold for keeping a conformer.

tab.name: Output

option.name: Column name for molecules with conformers

tab.option: The output column with the generated conformers.

option.name: Column name for copied reference data

tab.option: The output column with reference data taken from the input table.

tab.name: Advanced

option.name: Use random coordinates as a starting point instead of distance geometry

tab.option: Setting this flag will use random coordinates as a starting point instead of distance geometry.

option.name: Multiplier for the size of the box for random coordinates

tab.option: Specifies a multiplier for the size of the box for random coordinates.

option.name: Perform a cleanup using UFF (Universal force field) after calculation

tab.option: Set this flag to perform cleanup with UFF after the conformer's calculation. Just clear this flag to output unprocessed conformers in case you want to perform other processing on them before cleaning them up with a force field.
